pr_title: Hibernate Validator: status 400 instead of 500 if JAX-RS method is defined in interface

timeline.bodyText: Please use standard imperative code. This is far less readable.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
Ok, will change it.
After forcing myself to use streaming API for a few months after it came out, I can now actually read something like this better than a cascade of loops and ifs and local variables.
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText: Done. The method became more complex anyway.
replies.author: famod

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be better conceptually to pass the full list to the method rather than building it inside.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
Hm, the build() method is already packed with so many local variables which is why I aimed for a separate, very cohesive private method.
The full list is also not used by any other code in the processor.
But if you prefer it that way (and it is then more in line with other processors) I will change it.
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText: Ok, let's leave it at that.
replies.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText: You also need to check that the kind of the target is a method.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
I actually had this already, but what to do if it's not a method?

do nothing?
log a warning?
throw an explicit exception? (right now asMethod() will throw an exception if the target is not a method)

As far as I understood AdditionalJaxRsResourceMethodAnnotationsBuildItem, arbitrary annotations can be added and those annotations could be only or also class level annotations.
But the logic in the transformer is only considering methods.
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText:
Just saw #11506 (comment). So the last option is not valid.
I'll go with the first one (do nothing) but the question remains whether the transformer must consider class level annotations as well (probably yes).
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText: Yeah we should do nothing but we probably need to understand better how things work in the Spring compatibility layer. Let's discuss with @geoand next week.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Check + "do nothing" added (and a comment).
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText: See #11532 for the rest.
replies.author: famod

timeline.bodyText: The name is not sufficient, you need to build the signature.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Getting the parameters() then building something with the name() of the type should be good enough.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
I had the same thought while looking at inheritedAnnotationsToBeValidated which is also only considering the method names.
That is why I ignored this problem for now, but I should have left a comment.
But since you brought this up I guess I should fix both the new jaxRsMethods map and the already existing inheritedAnnotationsToBeValidated map?
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText: I think that would be a good idea if not more complex that I envision it.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
I'll take a stab at jaxRsMethods first and in case I have some time left and it is easy enough I'll adjust the other map as well.
Otherwise I'll create a follow-up issue/pr.
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText:
Done. jaxRsMethods is now holding Set<SimpleMethodSignatureKey> instead of Set<String>.
I'll have a look at inheritedAnnotationsToBeValidated next.
replies.author: famod

timeline.bodyText: Same here, you need to use the signature.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: famod

timeline.bodyText: I have another patch moving ResteasyDotNames to a common SPI so we will be able to use the constants there rather than have a copy.
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -92,6 +94,16 @@
 
     private static final DotName REPEATABLE = DotName.createSimple(Repeatable.class.getName());
 
+    private static final DotName[] JAXRS_METHOD_ANNOTATIONS = {
+            DotName.createSimple("javax.ws.rs.GET"),
+            DotName.createSimple("javax.ws.rs.HEAD"),
+            DotName.createSimple("javax.ws.rs.DELETE"),
+            DotName.createSimple("javax.ws.rs.OPTIONS"),
+            DotName.createSimple("javax.ws.rs.PATCH"),
+            DotName.createSimple("javax.ws.rs.POST"),
+            DotName.createSimple("javax.ws.rs.PUT"),
+    };

replies.bodyText: So I should wait for that PR?
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText: it should be merged before the end of the day. Let's see depending on where you're at, we can do it in a follow-up.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Done via a separate commit to allow for backporting without necessarily backporting (parts of) #11462.
replies.author: famod

timeline.bodyText: Don't you also need to consider the superclasses?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Well, I'd say yes. Same problem as described here: #11506 (comment)
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText:
I only added a check for the direct superclass, since I do not have the entire ClassInfo hierarchy.
TBH, I would like to stop at this point for this PR as far as superclasses are concerned.
replies.author: famod

replies.bodyText: I'll mark this as resolved and once this is merged I'll create a follow-up issue.
replies.author: famod

timeline.message: Hibernate Validator: status 400 instead of 500 if JAX-RS method is defined in interface

Revert "Disable the JDK 14 build for now as it's totally unstable"

This reverts commit df381123c04c1c060e88974c93d4927f8602f0df.
